Annotate a pair of English-French input sentences. The goal is to label every word in each sentence regarding its semantic similarity to the words in the other sentence.

Output: {"sentence1": [["Former", 0.4],["Nazi", 0.4],["death", 0.4],["camp", 0.4],["guard", 0.4],["Demjanjuk", 0.4],["dead", 0],["at", 0],["91", 0]],"sentence2":[["John", -1], ["Demjanjuk", -1], ["", -1], ["", -1], ["gardien", -1], ["des", -1], ["camps", -1], ["de", -1], ["la", -1], ["mort", -1], ["nazis", -1], ["", -1], ["", -1], ["meurt", -1], ["à", -1], ["l", -1], ["'", -1], ["âge", -1], ["de", -1], ["91", -1], ["ans", -1]]}

Input sentence 2: ["Les", "femmes", "saoudiennes", "autorisées", "à", "participer", "aux", "Jeux", "olympiques"]

## Example 3:

Input sentence 2: ["Un", "séisme", "de", "magnitude", "6", "", "", "3", "frappe", "les", "îles", "Salomon", ":", "USGS"]
Output: {"sentence1": [["6.8", 0.2], ["quake", 0.2], ["strikes", 0], ["off", 0], ["Solomon", 0], ["Islands", 0]], "sentence2": [["Un", -1], ["séisme", -1], ["de", -1], ["magnitude", -1], ["6", -1], ["", -1], ["", -1], ["3", -1], ["frappe", -1], ["les", -1], ["îles", -1], ["Salomon", -1], [":", -1], ["USGS", -1]]}

* **1–2** Slightly similar or somewhat similar.
